subtitle: light on the path a treatise written for
the personal use of those who are
ignorant of the Eastern wisdom and who
desire to enter within his influence
written down by Mabel Collins
introduction on the title page of the
first edition of this book published in
1885 it is described as a treatise
written for the personal use of those
who are ignorant to the eastern wisdom
who desire to enter within its influence
but the book itself begins with a
statement that these rules are written
for all disciples the latter description
is surely the more accurate one as the
history of the book will show as we have
said here at president was dictated by
the master hilarion to the mediumship of
Mabel Collins a lady well-known in the
Theosophical circles who at one time
collaborated with Madame Blavatsky in
the editorship of Lucifer the master
Halloran received it from his own
teacher the great one among Theosophical
students is sometimes called the
Venetian but even he is the author only
a part of it it has passed down through
three phases let us set them down in
order it is but a small book even now
but the first form in which we see it is
smaller yet it is a palm-leaf manuscript
beyond computation so old that even
before the time of Christ men had
already forgotten its date and the name
of its writer and regarded its origin as
lost in the midst of prehistoric
antiquity it consists of ten leaves and
on each leave are written three lines
only four on a palm leaf manuscripts run
along the page and not across it as it
was each line is complete in itself the
short aphorism in order that these
thirty lines may be clearly
distinguishable they are printed in this
edition in black type the language in
which these aphorisms are written is an
archaic form of Sanskrit the venetian
master translated them from sanskrit
into greek for the use of as Alexandrian
pupils of whom the master Hilarion was
one in his incarnation as I am Blucas
not only did he translate the aphorisms
but he added to them certain
explanations which we shall do well to
take along with the original for example
if we look at the first three aphorisms
we shall see that the paragraph marked
four which follow them is clearly
intended as a commentary
so that we should read it if thus killer
ambition but work is those work who are
ambitious kill out desire of life but
respect life as those who do desire it
kill out desire of comfort but be happy
as those are who live for happiness all
these explanations and amplification the
